title: Chapter 1 — The Power of Expression
objectives: Explain why gesture and nonverbal expression carry meaning across cultures.
Define key terms (gesture, stack, accessibility, inclusion, SEL, etc.).
Practice core Stack gestures and begin a personal/group Stack.
Plan and pace a 2-session flow with SEL and accessibility supports.

vocab.def: A movement, usually of the hand or body, that shows a feeling or idea.
A personal or group sequence of gestures that shows identity, emotion, or purpose.
Communication that happens without speaking, like body language or facial expressions.
The way someone shares thoughts, emotions, or ideas — through speech, writing, art, or movement.
Making sure everyone, no matter their ability, can take part fully and equally.
Learning how to understand and manage emotions, relationships, and decision-making.
Making sure no one is left out — everyone has a voice and a place.
Gaining the confidence and tools to express yourself and make an impact.
A picture, sign, or action that stands for something else.
A collection of your work that shows what you’ve learned and created.
How someone presents themselves online or through tech tools.
A presentation or display of your skills or project.
A complete language using hand signs and facial expressions to communicate, used by many Deaf people.
Describes people who think, learn, or experience the world differently — like ADHD or Autism.
The ideas, traditions, and expressions shared by a group of people.

sections.heading: Standards Alignment
sections.body:
CR12.1, CR12.3, CR12.4, ISTE 1.6 Creative Communicator, CSTA 1A-CS-01

Notes:
• Supports ESSA Title IV (well-being and nonverbal SEL strategies)
• IDEA-aligned options for diverse communication needs

sections.heading: Time Frame + Pacing Guide — Overview
sections.body:
Total Time: 2 sessions • 45–60 minutes each
This pacing allows movement, creativity, SEL check-ins, and student-led creation. Stretch to 3 sessions for deeper reflection or showcase prep.

sections.heading: Session 1 — Expression + Gesture Literacy (45–60 min)
sections.body:
Sections Covered: 1.1 Expression Is Power • 1.2 Designing Stack

Suggested Flow:
0–10 mins  Hook — Clips of gestures in culture (protests, sports, ASL) to spark discussion
10–20 mins Vocabulary Walk — Introduce vocabulary with visuals/body-based examples
20–35 mins Gesture Practice — Core Stack gestures (heart tap, point forward, raise hand, etc.). Pair-share: "Which one felt powerful and why?"
35–45 mins Mini-Design — Draft a personal Stack (sketch or movement)
Optional  Exit Ticket — “One gesture I connected with today is ____ because ____.”

sections.heading: Session 2 — Showcase, SEL Reflection + Tech Layer (45–60 min)
sections.body:
Sections Covered: 1.3 SEL/Accessibility • 1.4 Tech, Culture, & Career • 1.5–1.6 Summary + Reflection

Suggested Flow:
0–10 mins  SEL Check-in — “How did your Stack feel to perform/explain yesterday?” Use emoji/gesture votes
10–25 mins Final Stack Creation — Complete and rehearse personal/group Stack (optional: record)
25–40 mins Showcase Presentations — Perform Stack + meaning; encourage peer “Stack to agree!”
40–50 mins Reflection Writing — Prompt: “Describe your Stack gesture. What does it mean to you?”
50–60 mins Careers Connection — Where gestures show up (design, games, apps, marketing). Optional: brainstorm Stack emojis

sections.heading: Mapping Integration Tags
sections.body:
1.1 Expression — 10–15 min — SEL, Culture, CR12.1, Empowerment
1.2 Designing Stack — 20–25 min — CSTA 1A-CS-01, Creativity, Movement
1.3 SEL/Accessibility — 10–15 min — IDEA, ESSA, Differentiation
1.4 Tech + Careers — 10–15 min — Perkins V, Digital Identity
1.5 Summary — 5 min — Reflection, SEL
1.6 Student Prompt — 10–15 min — Journaling, Portfolio Artifact

reflectionPrompt: Describe your Stack gesture. What does it mean to you? Why did you choose it?
summary: Gestures carry power and access. By crafting a personal or group Stack, students communicate identity and values, and practice inclusive, nonverbal expression.
